info.title: Pick and Pack Protocol API
info.description:
The variables used in this collection are:

`{{environment}}` = Can be either `dev` or `prod`

`{{pnpApiKey}}` = API Key from Pick and Pack

`{{carrierId}}` = CarrierID from Pikc and Pack

---

#### General instructions for using the API

All API access is over HTTPS and accessed from `https://api.pickingnpacking.com` . All data is sent and received as JSON.

Blank fields are included as `null` instead of being omitted.

All timestamps returned in UTC, ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ` .

All distance measurements are in meters.

post.description:
This is the information that VTEX will send to the carrier to create a service

[Link documentation](https://pickpack.slite.page/p/sSsujLMmbKNnbv/API-Carriers-integration-protocol#97a8aeb1%5C%5D)

get.description: The following endpoint returns information about a service, which can be queried by providing the carrier ID and the corresponding service ID as query parameters. The response returned by the endpoint will contain the requested information.

patch.description:
Service that allows updating the details of the tracking service via webhook.

**Body**

``` graphql
{
  status: PENDING | ASSIGNED | PICKED | ON_ROUTE | INCIDENT | RETURNED | DELIVERED
  agent: {
    id: String!
    name: String!
    identification: String
    phone: String
    email: String
    vehicle: SCOOTER | VAN | CAR | TRUCK | BIKE | WALK | DRONE
  }
  trackingUrl: String
  totalDistanceTraveled: Int
  rating: Float # 1-5
  shippingPrice: Float
  shippingEstimatedDate: String
}

 ```

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Shipment ID generated by the carrier

post.description:
Service that allows the carrier to add the shipping labels.

It is important that the tag ID is a unique value, if this value is repeated it will throw an exception

> ⚠️ If the label is type BASE64 or TXT, the max size that we allow is 180kb 
  

``` graphql
{
  id: String!
  url: String!
  name: String!
  type: PDF | BASE64 | TEXT | ZPL!
}

 ```

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Shipment ID generated by the carrier

post.description:
Service that will cancel an ongoing shipping service

``` graphql
{
  comment: String
  type: ERROR_CREATE_SERVICE  |  END_CLIENT_CANCELED  |  NO_THERE_DELIVERY_MAN_ASSIGN  |  OTHER!
}

 ```

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Shipment ID generated by the carrier

post.description:
Service that allows a carrier to temporarily pause a shipping service

``` graphql
{
  comment: String # reason
  type: ERROR_CREATE_SERVICE  |  END_CLIENT_PAUSE  |  NO_THERE_DELIVERY_MAN_ASSIGN  |  OTHER!
}

 ```

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Shipment ID generated by the carrier

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
To generate the `JWT` it is important to have the `API KEY` previously generated by the Pick and Pack team.

#### **Steps to generate JWT**

1. Create a token `JWT` from API Key of Pick and Pack
2. Send in the headers of the request `Authorization` with the `JWT` generated in step 1 for all endpoints of tracking(Shipping updates)

tags.name: Endpoints integrations
tags.description: These endpoints must be developed to integrate with the Lastmile Pick and Pack Protocol API

tags.name: Shipping updates
tags.description: This endpoint will allow the carriers to update an ongoing shipping service.
